subtitle: you've probably heard of Gobekli Tepe a
12 000 year old temple in Turkey Built 7
500 years before the pyramids but have
you heard of Bangkok lutarla estimated
to be 1 000 years older than Gobekli
Tepe this site is where ancient
Mesopotamian civilizations lived and
settled throughout history the Sumerians
the acadians Babylonians Hittites
Assyrians Romans and Celtics in fact 130
skeletons have been Unearthed the
ancient site uncovered a temple with 60
ton monoliths as well as other features
such as the earliest known window and
the oldest sewer system ever discovered
so why does the site matter the
civilization living in the region had
not only learned to farm but also
developed a culture and Community around
religious science much earlier than
previously thought however this is
controversial for centuries
archaeologists maintain That
civilization started 8 000 years ago but
konkuklutarla was built 5 000 years
before that it just might be time to
rewrite human history
